intro: [WRONG START] Citrus × yuge-hokan, commonly known as the Yuge-Hyokan mandarin. It is a hybrid citrus plant originating from Japan, characterized by its small, sweet, and seedless fruit. The tree has a compact growth habit with dark green, glossy leaves and produces fragrant white flowers. The fruit is typically round, with a thin, smooth peel and a juicy, segmented pulp. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of fresh fruit in subtropical climates.
